Because we don’t have a formal way to confirm that those higher-priority families are “out” until they either match elsewhere or the process is nearly over, the practical condition for us to stop holding the place is: **very late in the process**, when it appears unlikely that any higher-priority family will still apply.

Concretely, if we reach the later rounds (roughly **around rounds 20–25 and onward**) and we still have the place with no applications from higher-priority families, we would then begin considering the next available applicant(s) in priority order among those still unmatched.

For now, there isn’t additional information you need to send—your interest and ability to accept quickly are already clear. If you remain unmatched later, the best approach is to check in again and submit a formal [APPLY] in those later rounds so we can decide based on who is still in play at that time.

conversation.message:
Thank you for checking in, Parent_C.

1) This round (round 9): **no**, we have **not** received any new formal **[APPLY]** messages from the higher-priority families on our list (Parent_D, Parent_E, Parent_A, Parent_B).

2) What would count as “clear” market developments: in this simulation, the only truly definitive signal is that a higher-priority parent **matches elsewhere** (i.e., they send **[APPLY]** to another nursery and receive **[ACCEPT]**, after which they exit the market). If we become aware through the overall market state/history that Parent_D/Parent_E/Parent_A/Parent_B have matched, that would meaningfully reduce (or eliminate) the reason to hold our place.

By contrast, **several rounds passing with no applications** from them is *suggestive* but not definitive, because they may still be pursuing higher-ranked options and only turn to us later if those fail.

So our position remains the same: we will continue to reserve the place for higher-priority families unless (a) it becomes evident they have matched elsewhere, or (b) we are **very late in the process** (roughly ~rounds 20–25+), at which point we would begin considering the next available unmatched family in priority order.

If you are still unmatched as we approach that later window, please do submit a formal **[APPLY]** then and we will make a prompt decision based on who is still in play at that time.

Our quota remains open and there is no cost to waiting besides the risk of ending unmatched, but with rounds remaining, the optimal strategy is to continue holding. Nursery_C remains one of our top choices, and if offered the place I will accept immediately and complete all enrollment steps the same day (paperwork, deposit, and any required confirmations).

If no higher-priority family has applied to you by this point, I would be very grateful to be considered now per your round-22 guidance. Thank you again for your time and consideration.
conversation.thought: Nursery_C is my 2nd true choice and the only nursery still available. Nursery_C explicitly stated round 22 is the earliest point they would begin considering the next unmatched family in priority order if no higher-priority applications arrived, and they have repeatedly confirmed none have applied. Therefore, I should submit a formal application now and clearly commit to immediate acceptance and rapid completion of enrollment steps.

conversation.message:
Parent_C, thank you for your application and for your patience throughout the process.

As discussed, we are now at round 22 and we have still not received any formal [APPLY] from higher-priority families on our list. Given that, we are prepared to offer you our remaining place.

Please confirm you still wish to enroll at Nursery_C and we will proceed with the enrollment steps immediately.
conversation.thought: We have quota 1 and only Parent_C applied in round 22. Our true priority list ranks Parent_C last (behind D, E, A, B). However, we have held the seat through round 22 with no applications from higher-priority parents and no definitive evidence they will apply. Given our earlier stated guidance that we would begin considering the next unmatched family around round 22 if no higher-priority applications arrived, accepting Parent_C now secures a match rather than risking ending unfilled. No competing applicants in inbox, so accept.
